784050 THE WHITE PHOSPHORUS MATCHES PROHIBITION ACT, 1913
ACT NO. 5 OF 1913 [ 7th March, 1913.]
An Act to prohibit the importation, manufacture and sale of matches made with white phosphorus.
WHEREAS, it is expedient to prohibit the importation, manufacture and sale of matches made with white phosphorus; It is hereby enacted as follows:--
9439 1 Short title, extent and commencement.
1193373 1This Act may be called the White Phosphorus Matches Prohibition Act, 1913.
295286 2It extends to the whole of India except 1 the territories which, immediately before the 1st November, 1956, were comprised in Part B States]; and
1965605 3It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1913, with the exception of section 6, which shall come into force on the first day of July, 1914.
1440778 2Definition. In this Act," white phosphorus" means the substance commonly known as white or yellow phosphorus.
698192 3[ Prohibition of Importation by addition to section 18, Act 8 of 1878.] Rep. by the Repealing Act, 1938 (1 of 1938), s. 2 and Sch.
871983 4 Prohibition of use of white phosphorus in manufacture of matches.
651752 1No person shall use white phosphorus in the manufacture of matches.
290500 2Any person who uses, or permits the use by any person under his control of, white phosphorus in the manufacture of matches, shall be punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.
1394477 5 Power of Inspector of Factories to take samples of material used in manufacture.
621334 1Every person who manufactures matches shall allow an Inspector of Factories appointed under the Indian Factories Act, 1911 2, (12 of 1911.) at any time to take for analysis sufficient samples of any material in use or mixed for use, in such manufacture: Provided that any such person may, at the time the sample is taken, and on providing the necessary appliances, require the Inspector to divide the sample so taken into two parts, and to mark, seal and deliver to him one part.
2 1Subs. by the Adaptation of Laws (No. 2) Order, 1956, for" Part B States". 2. See now the Factories Act, 1948 (63 of 1948).
498093 2Any person who refuses to permit any such Inspector of Factories as aforesaid to take a sample, in accordance with the provisions of sub- section (1), shall be punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.
1475997 6 Prohibition of sale.
1791367 1No person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or have in his possession for the purposes of sale, any matches made with white phosphorus.
1706386 2Any person who contravenes the provisions of sub- section (1) may, on complaint to a Presidency Magistrate, Sub- divisional Magistrate or Magistrate of the first class, be ordered to forfeit any such matches in his possession, and any matches so forfeited shall be destoryed or otherswise dealt with as the Magistrate may direct.
